intro: Arthrostachya coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sturt's currant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals, and it produces small, red berries that are edible. Arthrostachya coarctata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
